main event: A star-like object was observed in Albany, New York on April 8, 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as being at an azimuth of 310 degrees from the tower., The sighting lasted for 2 minutes., The object faded over the horizon., The object could possibly be Venus based on its position., The sighting was executed from the ground using binoculars.
witness description: Observation made from the control tower by Leo Gline, a control tower operator.
